Direzione o partecipazione a comitati ed.content: Member of the Editorial Board, Polis
Member of the Editorial Board, Italian Political Science (IPS)
Member of the Editorial Board, Rivista Italiana di Politiche Pubbliche
Associate editor, Routledge Studies in Globalisation Series
Editor "International Political Economy: Monetary Relations eJournal", Political Science Network, Social Science Research Network (SSRN)
Member of the Editorial Board, The Annals of the Fondazione Luigi Einaudi. An Interdisciplinary Journal of Economics, History and Political Science

Organizzazione o partecipazione come rel.content: The identity of the IMF in an era of globalized finance. Consensus and contestation in Amending the Articles of Agreement, Paper presented at the 1st ECPR Graduate Conference, University of Essex, United Kingdom, 7-9 September 2006.

A New Role of the IMF in an Era of Globalized Finance. Testing the Idea of Orderly Liberalization, Paper presented at the annual meeting of the Società Italiana di Scienza della Politica (SISP), Bologna, 12-14 September 2006.

Rights for the Markets: International Standard Effectiveness through Participation and Transparency, co-authored with Silvia Pellizzari, Paper presented at the annual meeting of the Società Italiana di Scienza della Politica (SISP), Catania, 20-22 September 2007.

The International Monetary Fund and Capital Account Liberalization: A Case of Failed Norm Institutionalization, co-authored with Ralf J. Leiteritz. Paper presented at the Annual Meeting of the International Studies Association, San Francisco, USA, 25-29 marzo 2008.
Seeing like the IMF on Capital Account Liberalization, Paper presented at the Annual Meeting of the International Studies Association, San Francisco, USA, 25-29 March 2008.

When Ideas Fail to Influence Policy Outcomes: Orderly Liberalization and the International Monetary Fund, Paper presented at the conference The International Monetary Fund and Financial Crises: The Role of Institutional and Governance Reform, Research Project on Trade, Finance and Regulation, Cambridge University, UK, 3-5 April 2008.

Preventing and Managing Crises: Cooperation or Duplication in the International Financial Architecture? Paper presented at the International Workshop The global economy after the crisis: macroeconomic and geopolitical implications, organized by Dipartimento di Economia e Scuola di Studi Internazioanli dell’Università di Trento, Trento, 25-27 June 2009

Transaction and Control Costs in International Financial Governance: The Financial Stability Board and the G20 in Comparative Perspective, Paper presented at the workshop organized by the Italian Standing Group di Relazioni Internazionali (SGRI), Milan, 19 November 2009.
Effectiveness and Accountability in Global Financial Governance, Paper presented at the Annual Convention of the International Studies Association, New Orleans, USA, 17-20 February 2010.

From the Neoliberal to the Regulated Model of Capitalism: The EU and the International Financial Architecture Exercise, Paper presented at the ECPR Joint Sessions, Panel: "Contested Policies: European Socio-Economic Governance and the Global Economic Crisis", Muenster, 23-27 March 2010.
The Agenda-Setting of Hedge Funds at the EU level, Paper presented at the annual meeting of the Società Italiana di Scienza della Politica (SISP), Venice, 16-19 September 2010.
The IMF and Civil Society, co-authored with Roberto Belloni. Paper presented at the annual meeting of the Società Italiana di Scienza della Politica (SISP), Venice, 16-19 September 2010.
The Organizational and Political Constraints of IMF Reform: Rethinking Surveillance, Paper presented at the Annual Convention of the International Studies Association, Montreal, 16-19 March 2011.

Organizational Field and Institutional Development: Explaining the Dynamics of IMF’s Policy Change, co-authored with Antje Vetterlein, Paper presented at the Workshop Institutional Dynamics in World Politics, Social Science Research Center, Berlin, 7-8 April 2011.
"Explaining Incremental Change in Global Financial Governance", Workshop Convenor (with Eleni Tsingou), ECPR Research Sessions, Istituto Universitario Europeo, Fiesole, 26-28 May 2011.

Coming Full Circle: The Representative Democracy Turn, co-authored with Barbara Guastaferro, Paper presented at the Workshop The Causes, Consequences and Democratic Legitimacy of International Institutions, University of St Gallen, Switzerland, 9-10 June 2011.

Problems of Institutional Design: Explaining Mandate, Discretion and Membership of the Financial Stability Board, Paper presented at the annual meeting of the Società Italiana di Scienza della Politica (SISP), Palermo, 8-10 September 2011.

"Le organizzazioni internazionali in prospettiva comparata", Panel Convenor (with Roberto Belloni and Daniela Sicurelli), Annual Conference of the Società Italiana di Scienza Politica, Palermo, 8-10 September 2011.

IOs, Information Gathering, and the Construction of Global Governance, co-authored with Liam Clegg, Paper presented at the Annual Convention of the International Studies Association, San Diego, 1-4 April 2012.
"International Organizations: Problems and Implications of Information Collection and Distribution", Panel Convenor (with Liam Clegg), International Studies Association, San Diego, 1-4 April 2012.
The Governance of Crises: New Modes in IMF Crisis Lending, Paper presented at the Annual Convention of the International Studies Association, San Diego, 1-4 April 2012.

The institutional roots of incremental ideational change. The IMF, capital controls and the global financial crisis, Paper presented at the ECPR Joint Session, Panel: Economic Ideas and the Political Construction and Meaning of Financial Crisis, Antwerp, 10-15 April 2012.

The institutional roots of incremental ideational change. The IMF, capital controls and the global financial crisis, Paper presented the IPEG-BISA Annual Convention, The Future of Global Economic Governance, Birmingham, 10-11 September 2012.

Administration Member Collegio accademico della Scuola Normale Superiore (2016 – present); Member, Commissione Ricerca, Scuola Normale Superiore (dal 1 novembre 2016 – present); Member, Comitato scientifico del Centro Biblioteca della Scuola Normale Superiore (2015- present); Member, Collegio di disciplina della Scuola Normale Superiore (2015- present); Member (Alternate) Comitato Unico di Garanzia, Scuola Normale Superiore (2015- present);

Direzione o partecipazione alle attivit\.content: Member of the research team for the project “Owning Development: Creating Global Policy Norms in the IMF and the World Bank”, selected and funded by the International Studies Association (ISA) for the 2008 Catalytic Workshop Grant. Project led by Susan Park (University of Sydney) and Antje Vetterlein (Copenhagen Business School) culminated in the publication of the book Owning Development: Creating Global Development Policy Norms in the World Bank and the IMF, Susan Park and Antje Vetterlein (eds), Cambridge: Cambridge University Press, 2010

Member of the research team for the project “Seeing like an International Organization” led by André Broome (University of Birmingham) and Leonard Seabrooke (Copenhagen Business School). Project culminated in the Special Issue “Seeing like an International Organization”, 2012, 17(1).

Principal investigator (with Eleni Tsingou, Copenhagen Business School) for the research project “Opportunities and constraints in reshaping global economic governance” selected for the 2011 Research Sessions by the European Consortium for Political Research (ECPR). Project culminated in the edited book: M. Moschella and E. Tsingou (2013) eds, Great Expectations, Slow Transformations: Incremental change in post-crisis regulation, Colchester UK, ECPR Press; and M. Moschella and E. Tsingou, (guest editors), “Regulating finance following the crisis: Unveiling the different dynamics of the regulatory process”, Special Issue in Regulation & Governance, 2013, vol. 7 (4).

Research coordinator (with Catherine Weaver, University of Texas Austin) for the development of the new version of the Routledge Handbook of Global Economic Governance, published as M. Moschella and C. Weaver (2013) eds, Handbook of Global Economic Governance. Players, Power and Paradigms, London, Routledge
Member of the research team for the project “La Politica Estera Italiana di fronte alle nuove sfide del sistema internazionale: attori, istituzioni e politiche”, PRIN 2010-2011.

Member of the research team for the project “Banking Regulation and Supervision and the Great Leap Forward in European Integration”, selected for the 2014 ECPR Joint Sessions (Workshop title) ‘National vs. Supranational Banking Supervision’) and led by David Howarth (University of Luxembourg) and Huw Macartney (University of Birmingham). Project culminated in the Special Issue “The Politics of Supranational Banking Supervision in Europe”, West European Politics, 2016, vol. 39 (3).

Member of the research team for the project “The New Interdependence Approach: Theoretical Development and Empirical Demonstration”, with the financial support of the Mortara Center Georgetown University and led by Henry Farrell (George Washington University) and Abraham Newmann (Georgetown University). Project culminated in the Special Issue “The New Interdependence Approach: Theoretical Development and Empirical Demonstration”, in the Review of International Political Economy, 2016.

Member of the research team for the project “Democracy without Solidarity: Political Dysfunction in Hard Times”, led by Erik Jones (Johns Hopkins University) and Matthias Matthjis (Johns Hopkins University).

Workshop director (with Samuel MacPhilemy, Warwick University and Bank of England) of the panel "The politics of central banking", ECPR Joint Sessions, Pisa, 2016. The panel led to the research project “Independent agencies under stress: Central Banks in the aftermath of the Great Recession” selected by the journal Public Administration among the Symposium proposals for 2017

The Political-Economy Determinants of Supranational Economic Surveillance (MONE) - €36,850 (1 marzo 2013 - 30 settembre 2014 – esteso fino 1 marzo 2015 per congedo di maternità)
Scientific Independence Research (SIR) grant, MIUR, Research Project RBSI14KCWY: Unconventional Central Banks: Making Monetary Policy in Hard Times (UNCENTRAL), €195,000 (durata 36 mesi)

Progetti coordinati, Scuola Normale Superiore, Bando n° 131 del 17/03/2015, Research project: The “operationalization” of macroprudential regulation: giving meaning to systemic risk in the advanced economies, €30,000 (durata 12 mesi)
